content.text: How much millet is there in \(15\mathrm{kg}\) of bird food?
In a small bag of bird food there is \(60 \mathrm{g}\) of sunflower seed
What is the mass of bird food in a small bag?
The amounts of sunflower seed, millet and maize are in the ratio
Sunflower seeds cost \(\)204.50\(for\) 30kg from Jon's farm or\) \ \(96.40\) for \(20\mathrm{kg}\) from Ann's farm. The exchange rate is \(\)1\(= \)\pounds 0.718\)
Which farm has the cheapest price per kilogram?
**You must show clearly all your working.**
Bags are filled with bird food at a rate of 420 grams per second
How many \(20\mathrm{kg}\) bags can be completely filled in 4 hours?
Brian buys bags of bird food from the factory and sells them in his shop for \$15.30 each. He makes \(12.5\%\) profit on each bag
How much does Brian pay for each bag of bird food?
Brian orders 600 bags of bird food
The probability that a bag is damaged is \(\frac{1}{50}\)
How many bags would Brian expect to be damaged?
A factory produces bird food made with sunflower seed, millet and maize

Calculate the area of the triangle \(ABC\)
Calculate the perimeter of the whole field \(ABCD\)
The diagram represents a field in the shape of a quadrilateral \(ABCD\)
Show all your working and give your answers correct to two decimal places
Write \(\frac{6}{3x - 1} - \frac{2}{x - 2}\) as a single fraction in its simplest form
Points \(A\) , \(C\) and \(D\) lie on a circle centre \(O\)
\(BA\) and \(BC\) are tangents to the circle
Give the reason why angle \(DOA\) is \(34^{\circ}\)
The radius of the circle is \(12\mathrm{cm}\) . Calculate the length of major arc \(ABCD\)
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are on the circumference of the circle centre \(O\)

Calculate the mean mass of all the potatoes in the bag

For this amount of money, how many boxes of each size did he make?
The price of the small box is \$20 and the price of the large box is \$45

He makes at least 5 small boxes
The greatest number of large boxes he can make is 8
The greatest total number of boxes is 14
The number of large boxes is at least half the number of small boxes

Use your tangent to estimate the gradient of the curve at \(x = 2.5\)

Complete the Venn diagram to show this information
One student is chosen at random
Find the probability that this student studies both French and Spanish
Two students are chosen at random without replacement
Find the probability that they both study only Spanish
16 students study French and 18 students study Spanish
Draw a Venn diagram to represent this information
Find the total number of students in this class
In another class the students all study at least one language from French, German and Spanish
No student studies all three languages
The set of students who study German is a proper subset of the set of students who study French
4 students study both French and German
12 students study Spanish but not French
9 students study French but not Spanish
A total of 16 students study French
